alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 5:32PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Chelan County through 600 PM PDT... At 532 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stevens Pass, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Merrit, Lake Creek Campground, Telma, Lake Wenatchee Campground, White Pine Campground, and Riverside Campground. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 68 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County
